params.target: The address of the target contract.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.destTokenAddress: The address of the destination token contract.
params.sourceTokenAddress: The address of the source token contract.
params.sourceTokenAmount: The amount of source tokens to get the rate for.

params.destTokenAddress: The address of the destination token contract.
params.sourceTokenAddress: The address of the source token contract.
params.sourceTokenAmount: The amount of source tokens to get the return for.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

getContractHexName(string).notice: Get the hex name of a contract.

getSovrynSwapNetworkContract(address).notice: Look up the Sovryn swap network contract registered at the given address.

initialize(address).notice: Set function selectors on target contract.

swapsImplExpectedRate(address,address,ui.notice: Get the expected rate for 1 source token when exchanging the  given amount of source tokens.

swapsImplExpectedReturn(address,address,.notice: Get the expected return amount when exchanging the given  amount of source tokens.Right now, this function is being called directly by _swapsExpectedReturn from the protocol So, this function is not using _getConversionPath function since it will try to read the defaultPath storage which is stored in the protocol's slot, and it will cause an issue for direct call. Instead, this function is accepting additional parameters called defaultPath which value can be declared by the caller (protocol in this case).
